metadata.title: CVE-2020-25694 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: A flaw was found in PostgreSQL versions before 13.1, before 12.5, before11.10, before 10.15, before 9.6.20 and before 9.5.24. If a clientapplication that creates additional database connections only reuses thebasic connection parameters while dropping security-relevant parameters, anopportunity for a man-in-the-middle attack, or the ability to observeclear-text transmissions, could exist. The highest threat from thisvulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as well as systemavailability.

criterions.comment: postgresql-9.3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
postgresql-9.1: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
